sentences.english: This cluster of record-breaking events could be merely an streak of bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 这一连串破纪录的事件也许只是一连串的霉运。

sentences.english: But if Aguero wants to go to Real Madrid, tough luck for us.
sentences.chinese: 但如果阿圭罗想要去皇家马德里，对我们来说是霉运。

sentences.english: The aim here is to rid your home of any bad luck that's accumulated over the past year.
sentences.chinese: 这样做的目的是去除家里旧年累积的任何霉运。

sentences.english: And who knows if it will not bring us bad fortune?
sentences.chinese: 谁知道他会不会给我们带来霉运？

sentences.english: I'm going to give you five seconds to apologize for jinxing me.
sentences.chinese: 给你五秒钟对我道歉，是你把霉运带来了。

sentences.english: A brief note on hexes, jinxes, and curses.
sentences.chinese: 这里是有关恶咒，霉运咒和诅咒的一小段说明。

sentences.english: If you depend on it, you're out of luck.
sentences.chinese: 如果你过于依赖他的话，我只能说霉运离你不远了。

sentences.english: A young man down on his luck might do anything to get money.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人在走霉运的时候可能会不顾一切去搞钱。

definition: variant of 厄運|厄运[e4 yun4]
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
luck with the ladies/a romance/good luck
misfortune turns to blessing (idiom); to turn an inauspicious start to good account
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
